brewery.brewery_description:
Oakham Ales was established in 1993 in Oakham (Rutland) - the first beer brewed was Jeffrey Hudson Bitter (JHB). 

In 1998 the brewery relocated to new premises in Peterborough, a 35 barrel plant being installed in the new Brewery Tap brew pub. Rapidly increasing demand meant that capacity at the Brewery Tap site was reached and in October 2006 a new 75 barrel brewery was opened in the Woodston area of Peterborough.

In 2009 on another hop sourcing visit to the USA, John Bryan, our Brewing Director, discovered an exceptional new hop variety – Citra. He instantly fell in love with it and couldn’t wait to brew with it. He rushed it to the UK, ensuring that Oakham Ales were the first brewery to brew a beer with 100% Citra hops. Citra is now our best selling beer.

Volume has doubled in the last few years with particularly rapid growth in bottled beer production and Oakham Ales today brews over 25000 brewers barrels a year (43000 HL) of beer per year. That’s more than 7m pints! 

We are now going through ambitious expansion works that will enable us to diversify more into producing exciting keg beers.

user.bio: Ex Refreshment Coordinator Wheel/Bake/Old Bay Alehouses, Thanet properjob ambassador & cenosilicaphobic

beer.beer_description:
Cask ABV: 4.2%, Bottle ABV: 4.6%
Light gold in colour, bursting with citrus and tropical hop flavours and sensationally refreshing. The original UK Citra.

In 2009 on his annual hop sourcing visit to the USA, Oakham's Brewing Director John Bryan discovered an exceptional new hop variety - Citra. He rushed it to the UK, ensuring that Oakham Ales were the first UK brewery to brew a beer with 100% Citra hops and maintaining Oakham's reputation for pioneering innovation.

Cask ABV: 4.2%, Bottle ABV: 4.6%
Light gold in colour, bursting with citrus and tropical hop flavours and sensationally refreshing. The original UK Citra.

In 2009 on his annual hop sourcing visit to the USA, Oakham's Brewing Director John Bryan discovered an exceptional new hop variety - Citra. He rushed it to the UK, ensuring that Oakham Ales were the first UK brewery to brew a beer with 100% Citra hops and maintaining Oakham's reputation for pioneering innovation.

items.badge_description: There's beer in them thar hills! You're setting off on your journey through the world of beer, but be sure to take a little time to get to know each brewery as you go. That's a beer from 35 different breweries. Try 5 more for Level 8!
Traveling the world is hard, but not for you. It's as easy as cracking open a new brew! You have had a beer from at least 30 different regions around the world. Try 5 more for Level 7!

Fresh from the tap is one of the best ways to enjoy a beer. Just try to use a glass and not drink directly from the tap, as tempting as it may be. That's 20 checkins with the serving style of Draft. Try 5 more for Level 5!

Tropical fruit and aromatic herbal notes from Nectaron radiate pulsatingly with the pine resin and robust grapefruit notes of Chinook

items.badge_description: There's beer in them thar hills! You're setting off on your journey through the world of beer, but be sure to take a little time to get to know each brewery as you go. That's a beer from 110 different breweries. Try 5 more for Level 23!
We believe in IPA and you should too. You certainly have a taste for the hops! That's 60 different IPAs. Try 5 more for Level 13! Want to learn more about this badge? Check out our podcast

While a pint of traditional English ale will always remain a staple, the craft beer scene in England, much like the rest of the world, has continued to grow at a rapid rate! That's 35 different beers from a brewery from England! Try 5 more for Level 8!

As the hub of the town's social scene, your local pub has what you're craving. Be sure to stop by for a pint or two! That's a beer at 30 different venues with the categories of Pub, Irish Pub or Gastropub. Visit 5 more for Level 7!

beer.beer_description:
A brand new Oakham American Pale Ale, aged in the cask for maximum aroma, flavour, body and condition.

Bold and forthright citrus and pine resin flavours above the horizon from punchy, USA sourced Amarillo, Simcoe and Centennial hops balanced with plenty of malt character.

Superbly refreshing and seriously satisfying!

A pale gold winter beer with plenty of tart fruit flavours and aroma of pine needles and grapefruit.
Hops: Nelson Sauvin, Eureka, Southern Cross, Rakau.

Cask ABV: 3.8%
Bottle ABV: 4.2% 
A golden beer whose aroma is dominated by hops that give characteristic citrus notes. Hops and fruit on the palate are balanced by malt and a bitter base. Dry hoppy finish with soft fruit flavors. A nationally respected ale, winner of numerous awards, JHB is a blond baby packed with flavour & perfect for those long sessions as well as a quick pint at lunchtime. This popular beer was crowned Champion beer of britain in the bitter category in 2001 and 1999. 

Hopped with: Challenger and Mount Hood.

Cask ABV: 4.2%, Bottle ABV: 4.6%
Light gold in colour, bursting with citrus and tropical hop flavours and sensationally refreshing. The original UK Citra.

In 2009 on his annual hop sourcing visit to the USA, Oakham's Brewing Director John Bryan discovered an exceptional new hop variety - Citra. He rushed it to the UK, ensuring that Oakham Ales were the first UK brewery to brew a beer with 100% Citra hops and maintaining Oakham's reputation for pioneering innovation.

A brand new Session IPA for November featuring USA sourced big hitters Amarillo, Chinook and Simcoe, rising UK hop star Jester and experimental UK variety CF247.

Citrus orange and lemon notes plus hints of tropical fruit, spice and pine resin lead on to a complex, moreish, grapefruit bitterness.

The imagery for “King at Arms” has been developed in conjunction with design students at Stamford College.

Thanks to all of the students who took part in the project and congratulations to Cerin Flyn Murthwaite-Bedding who came up with the winning design.

A pale gold winter beer with plenty of tart fruit flavours and aroma of pine needles and grapefruit.
Hops: Nelson Sauvin, Eureka, Southern Cross, Rakau.

items.badge_description: It's the final week! Week 4 wraps with the last 3 styles of this year's Year in Beer Style Hunt. You've just tried one of three available styles during the week.

beer.beer_description:
Cask ABV: 4.2%, Bottle ABV: 4.6%
Light gold in colour, bursting with citrus and tropical hop flavours and sensationally refreshing. The original UK Citra.

In 2009 on his annual hop sourcing visit to the USA, Oakham's Brewing Director John Bryan discovered an exceptional new hop variety - Citra. He rushed it to the UK, ensuring that Oakham Ales were the first UK brewery to brew a beer with 100% Citra hops and maintaining Oakham's reputation for pioneering innovation.

India Pale Ale was traditionally brewed strong with plenty of hops and the multi award winning Green Devil IPA carries this to new heights. Double hopped with 100% USA sources Citra hops, Green Devil is very much the big brother of Oakham’s Citra.

This contemporary IPA explodes with amazing hop harvest aromas, packs in big tropical and citrus hop flavours before a crisp, refreshing finish.

*4% on cask, 4.4% in bottles*
Flame gold in colour, this igniting ale flares complex fruits across your tongue leaving a dry fruity, thirst suppressing bitter finish.

Hopped with: Sterling, Amarillo, Centennial, Cascade, Chinook

Cask ABV: 3.8%
Bottle ABV: 4.2% 
A golden beer whose aroma is dominated by hops that give characteristic citrus notes. Hops and fruit on the palate are balanced by malt and a bitter base. Dry hoppy finish with soft fruit flavors. A nationally respected ale, winner of numerous awards, JHB is a blond baby packed with flavour & perfect for those long sessions as well as a quick pint at lunchtime. This popular beer was crowned Champion beer of britain in the bitter category in 2001 and 1999. 

Hopped with: Challenger and Mount Hood.

A golden, premium beer with a smooth, malty background, rich and fruity hop flavours and a refreshing finish.
First brewed in 1996 in honour of William John “Bishop Bill” Westwood on his retirement as Bishop of Peterborough. Bishops Farewell pioneered the use of the USA sourced Cascade hop – the variety that launched the craft beer revolution.  
Food Match: Chicken dishes – from roasts to Southern Fried.
Taste: Smooth, rich, fruity
Style: Golden Ale
Colour: Gold
ABV: Cask 4.6% / Bottle 5.0%
Hops: Cascade (USA), Challenger (UK)
Malts (Cask): Maris Otter and Wheat Malt
Malts (Bottles): Maris Otter and Clear Choice
Allergens: Contains Gluten

Cask ABV: 4.4%. Bottle ABV: 4.8%.
Juicy, exciting fruit flavours before an intense bitterness as sharp as a Macaw’s screech.

Hopped with: Summit and Amarillo.
Pale amber with a light malty base and powerful citrus hops. Brewed with five hops from the West Coast of the USA: Columbus, Simcoe, Citra, Amarillo, Centennial
Exploding with hop character, Citra T90 is brewed with powerful T90 hop pellets and left unfiltered for maximum flavour.

A pale gold winter beer with plenty of tart fruit flavours and aroma of pine needles and grapefruit.
Hops: Nelson Sauvin, Eureka, Southern Cross, Rakau.

This light and refreshing summer beer begins with a fruity aroma and taste before an endless wave of bitterness.

Hops: Cascade, Willamette, Chinook, Pacific Jade

Big dark malt flavours combine with a sweet and fruity hop taste to make this strong porter exceedingly drinkable.

Hopped with: Challenger, Bramling Cross, Styrian Goldings

White Dwarf is a light, predominantly English-hopped bitter, with fruit flavours shining through to a dry zesty finish. A real thirst quencher.
Hops: Challenger, Pioneer, Cascade.
20% Wheat Malt

This spicy, rich and 
unique beer is bursting with chocolate and 
coffee malt flavours. 

Hops: Amarillo, Chinook, Simcoe

Grapefruit, blackcurrant and pineapple flavours are diving through clouds of zesty lime in this sunburst golden beer.

Hopped with: Simcoe, Mosaic, Chinook
Golden with gooseberry and passionfruit flavours. Brewed with four hops from New Zealand and Australia: Nelson Sauvin, Vic. Secret, Enigma, Pacific Jade.

Rich elderflower aroma. Ripe red berries and citrus aromas. Long smooth fruity finish.

Hopped with: Brewers Gold, Spalt Select, Magnum.

Flavoured with Cholaca (100% pure cacao) and hopped with Cascade on top of a complex base of 7 different malts.

Robust and rich, dark and decadent and supernaturally smooth.

The unfiltered canned version of our Black Magic cask aged beer.

Premium bitter with insane hop aroma. Grapefruit and berry flavours before a citrus bitter finish.

Hops: Amarillo, Chinook, Cascade
Colour: Amber. Available - March.
An American pale ale style beer with a deep golden colour and a smooth caramalt base. Bursting with intense citrus and gooseberry aromas with a robust bitterness and a thirst quenching dry finish.

Earthy floral aromas and sweet fruit flavours lead to a long hoppy bittersweet finish.

Hopped with: Challenger, Savinjski Goldings.
Seasonal Ale - Melon, passion fruit and lemongrass combine in this single hop, pale golden beer showcasing the styrian wolf hop.

A smooth, dark and sumptuous stout brewed with no less than 8 different types of malt.

With as you’d expect, a liberal dash of moreish Oakham hoppiness from plenty of Centennial and Olicana hops.

Time to Bite the Bullet!

Hop: Simcoe, Mandarina Bavaria, Palisade
Colour: Amber
Taste: A rich malty amber beer with aromas of tangerine and tangy citrus with a hint of orange peel.

Featuring a tri-national hop line-up from New Zealand, UK and USA, we know that you’ll enjoy partying with this new Winter Pale Ale.

Gold in colour and full of trademark Oakham festive flavour!

Winter Wisp’s name and imagery has been developed in conjunction with design students at Stamford College.

Thanks to all of the students who took part in the project and congratulations to Lily Thompson who came up with the winning design.

Tangerine, grapefruit, lemon and a hint of rose combine in this light beer made from new varieties of hops from Germany and Slovenia.
Hops: Dragon, Mandarina Bavaria
